intro: Solms-laubachia zhongdianensis, commonly known as the Zhongdian solms-laubachia, is a rare and endemic flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it adapts to cold and arid conditions. Its botanical features include palmate leaves and a compact growth form, making it well-suited to its harsh environment. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
